reviewText:
I Don't really know how to put this: It is exactly what I've been looking for when it comes to drawing things. Granted, the graphics seem a little poor for the grid you build on, but when I found this, I was looking primarily for something to draw 2d maps, and that is easy enough, although I wish it came with instructions.

Tab - Item Menu
Space - Down, relative to where you are looking.
Q - Rotate an item
E - Rotate an item in a way different than Q
Shift - Works like sprinting in terms of movement, and works with space.

reviewText:
Metaverse Construction Kit is some kind of building toolset/ Demo game for  http://store.steampowered.com/app/325430


Having played Metaverse Construction Kit I can say at the moment it is very basic, but it looks like it most definitely has the potential to have really amazing building features. I would recommend anyone looking for an early access building sandbox game to keep an eye on Metaverse and The Construction Kit. If the main game plays anything like this, I can say it looks and feels nice and is really only lacking features and content.  Its my opinion that there is great groundwork here and that the developers just need to build off it.

reviewText: This review has been thought up over a course of a week or two.  All controls will be listed below.Firstly, I would like to compliment the music to which the game has been implemented with.  During the gradual progress of building, it provides a calming and relatively relaxed atmosphereic feeling to the player.  Given the current models, it seems next to anything can be built, from single rooms to cities and worlds (Provided you have the time, or desire for it.)  All while being free, with nice graphics as well, you get the benefit of both creating something with any tool at your hands, to bragging to your friends about the next Wonder of the World you've created.  There are, however, some misconceptions.  During the reviews, it is said that the game does not automatically place things in the center, which can lead to items being off with the previously placed object.  The game has a 'snatch and place', system, from what I can tell.  Items that are placed on one another generally stack in the center, although it is possible for them to stop stacking provided the angle you're working at.  I believe this allows for players to move things at a bend, perhaps if you wanted to create the Leaning Tower of Pisa, or a statue.  A railroad, even.  The 2nd snapshot provides an example of its system, allowing you to create large, or small, items which lean either way.  At some points, however, you do have to focus on an item in order to allign them correctly, perhaps through a small crack of sorts.\n\nHow can I see the controls in-game?If you wish to change the controls, press esc"
hoursPlayed:
and click "Reset to Default."
This will show you the controls.

Current Controls.Horizontal Movement - A+D
Vertical Movement - W + S
"Run" - Left Shift
Move Up - C
Move Down - Space
Rotate B.I.T. First Axis (Changes the object) - Q
Rotate B.I.T. Second Axis (Changes the object) - E
Action - E
Main Menu - Esc.
Simulation Time Shift  - F (Drag your mouse when holding F
voteText:
left or right.  The sun appears on different sides based on which way you move your mouse)
Action Modifier - Left Shift
Undo - Ctrl + Z
Toggle Construction UI - Tab

reviewText: A great game, it lives up to my high expectations. I really love the game, everything fits together nicely and I love the different kinds of materials and block types. However I do have a few suggestions to make the game better(if that is possible) 1. Remove the ability to place blocks under the ground. 2. Make the ground collidable. 3. Make the sun and certain materials like diamond ec. better. Thank you for reading this review, I really enjoy this game and I am really suprised on the fact that this game is only a few(almost 3 as I am writing this) months old. I hope this game grows and becomes multiplayer, and I cannot wait to see this game become the perfect building tool!!!

reviewText:
My PC Specs (Used to use this Software)

Core I3
Gtx 760
6gb Ram

This Editor is awesome. I really enjoy the functionalty. I bought the game, and wondered why it wasnt included, as this should be one product. However, this is the gateway drug. You can actualy design something of Value, Though I am still fooling with it in bits and pieces, at least until more stuff is added. Buy the game, invest in the future product.

Pros of this free software...

-Free
-Runs SMOOTH
-Limited, but EXCELLENT supply of textures
-As easy to use as Farcry Editors, but WAAAAYYYY easier.

Cons

-No scale model, So I cant exactly judge Door Heights and window heights
-No Test run (to figure out the flow of the map for real-time playthrough)
-Not enough textures (Brick, drywall,carpet, sand etc, missing)
-Should be able to paint out" the structures instead of block by block. sure
hoursPlayed: but the extra steps............\n\nof course this is early
voteText:
and I have my Wishlist

Wishlist for creation

-Weapons creation (planet explorers style of sorts)
-Vehicles
-In editor play(to test)

Get it

reviewText:
It's very, very basic and there's a lot of things wrong with it but it's free.

Nowhere do they tell you the controls (at least as I write this review):

left mouse clears block
hold right mouse to place block, release when in right place
wasd moves
space descend
? ascend
tab brings up menu where you can pick different block types (both texture and physical block shape).

What it badly needs right now:
1 stop blocks being able to be placed under the floor
2 stop blocks being able to be place underneath other blocks
3 add as an option the ability to snap blocks automatically to a grid the size of the basic cube you start with
4 make sure when you do this that clicking anywhere on the face of a block positions the block correctly in a line with the other one
5 tell people the keys! and allow them to change them
6 .obj export would be nice
